metadata.Title: CVE-2022-38178 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed EdDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
bind9-host - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
bind9-libs - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
bind9-utils - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
bind9utils - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
dnsutils - 1:9.18.1-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required
